content.rendered:
Frequently Asked Questions
about the Avéli® Cellulite Treatment

Find answers to common questions about the Avéli® cellulite treatment procedure and what to expect. Avéli® is designed to reduce the appearance of cellulite in the buttocks and thigh areas of adult females.

Learn how Avéli® identifies and releases the bands that cause cellulite dimples in a single in-office visit.

Below you’ll find answers to some common cellulite questions. Get answers to all your questions during a consultation with a provider.

Find a Provider
What is Avéli®?

Avéli® is the first and only cellulite procedure that identifies and releases the septa that cause cellulite dimples on the buttocks and thighs with a real-time confirmation of release – all in a single in-office visit. Avéli® is a minimally invasive procedure performed by a trained provider using local anesthesia and delivers meaningful long-term results.1

How do I know if Avéli® is right for me?

If you are a woman looking for long-term reduction in cellulite dimples from a single, minimally invasive in-office procedure, Avéli® could be for you!1 Schedule a consultation with an Avéli® provider to determine if you are a candidate. Find a provider.

Does Avéli® only treat cellulite dimples?

Avéli® is a procedure that treats the septa bands causing cellulite dimples. It is not a procedure that addresses other concerns often seen alongside cellulite, such as laxity or fat pockets.

Will I need multiple sessions?

Avéli® is designed to be a single, in-office procedure. During a single procedure your provider can fully treat the targeted cellulite dimples on both your buttocks and thighs with durable, long-term results.1

How long does an Avéli® procedure take?

A typical Avéli® procedure will take around an hour, including local anesthesia and the procedure itself. Exact timing will vary depending on the personalized procedure plan from your provider.

Is there any downtime after the procedure?

Little to none. In the clinical study, most patients returned to normal activities within 24-48 hours.4

Are there any side effects?

In the clinical study, the most common side effects reported were mild pain within the first 24 hours and bruising and tenderness to the touch which typically resolved within 30 days. Small areas of firmness, usually not visible or painful, typically resolved in a couple of months.4

How quickly will I see improvement in my cellulite?

The results of your Avéli® procedure should be visible once swelling and bruising subsides. By one month post-procedure you should start to see the effects of the procedure.4

Can I work out or exercise after the procedure?

It is recommended to avoid any strenuous activities or workouts in the first few days/weeks after the procedure to allow the area to heal.4 Be sure to ask your Avéli® provider for their complete post-procedure care recommendations.

How long will the results last?

Avéli® is FDA-cleared for long-term reduction in the appearance of cellulite in the buttocks and thigh areas of adult females. Patients in the clinical study demonstrated a reduction in the appearance of their cellulite when assessed one year after the procedure.1

How do I find an Avéli® provider?

Avéli® is currently available in select aesthetic dermatology and plastic surgery practices across the U.S. that have been trained as Avéli® providers. Ask your medical aesthetics provider if they offer Avéli®. Find a Provider.

Experience the Avéli® Difference

Find a provider in your area.

Search Now
